QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Trypsin and chymotrypsin in stool
QAPair.Answer: Trypsin and chymotrypsin are substances released from the pancreas during normal digestion. When the pancreas does not produce enough trypsin and chymotrypsin, smaller-than-normal amounts can be seen in a stool sample. This article discusses the test to measure trypsin and chymotrypsin in stool.
